snippet: The conviction of 43 employees of foreign nonprofit groups sends a chilling message to Egyptians who want to work for democratic change.
abstract: Editorial expresses alarm at Cairo Criminal Court's conviction of 43 employees of foreign nonprofit groups, including 16 Americans, on criminal charges; criticizes Secretary of State John Kerry's response to verdict as too weak; suggest verdict may be cause for United States to rethink its relationship with Egypt.
lead_paragraph: The conviction of 43 employees of foreign nonprofit groups sends a chilling message to Egyptians who want to work for democratic change.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
